Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TartanTeddyBear
Reviews.Content: The hotel has since changed it's name to Ibis Styles Berlin East hotel. The area is quiet and seems very residential / student accom. The initial impressions of they area in daylight weren't great but there was always people about and you feel safe walking at night. The nearest station is a U-Bahn, Samaritestrauss, which is literally a less than 5 mins walk from the hotel towards the main thoroughfare - Frankfurter Allee. The U-Bahn system is great with regular trains into Alexanderplatz and takes approx. We also found some great pubs / restaurants going in the opposite direction from when you head to the U-Bahn. We booked the hotel approx 6 months before travelling and got a fantastic price. The hotel was immaculate, perhaps newly refurbished since Ibis took over. There was even the distinct smell of new carpets !!! It was very clean and welcoming with extremely helpful staff available at reception/ bar / restaurant at all hours. There is free Wi-Fi throughout the building, and access to a PC in the reception area. The breakfast cost €8. The room was clean and functional with a brand new large HD TV with various channels (inc BBC World News and CNN). Beds and duvets were also brand new and very comfortable although maybe not if you like a hard mattress. I had no complaints. The bathroom also appeared to be completed refurbished and very clean fantastic powerful shower too, which is a must have in a hotel. We would definitely stay here again if in Berlin despite initial impressions.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, not a lovely area”
Reviews.Author: Cat_buxton
Reviews.Content: Having finally found the hotel we were relieved to find that the staff were welcoming and the room large comfortable, if a little clinical. Going out in search of a restaurant on the first night we were surprised to find how much rougher the area was. It was poorly lit away from the main street and quiet, punctuated groups of youths smoking and drinking. The area is fine during the day but even as early as 9pm my mother and I didn't feel safe walking in the streets. Back to the hotel the breakfast was varied and good quality. Also takes a good 15 mins by underground to get into the city and is a trek to walk. Will spend a little more to stay further in next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great vaule for money”
Reviews.Author: tezzatrfc
Reviews.Content: spent 2 night at this hotel at the end of jan 12. Hotel is actually now called Ibis style. Hotel isnt very central but Berlin is that big where is? Tube stop is about a 5 mins walk away, You can get a day ticket for about 5 euro or a single which is vaild for about 90 mins. Hotel room we had was small but did have a large bathroom. Hotel was very clean and couldnt fault the place for the price. It was -10 when we visted ha, the hotel heating was superb and always on. Overall hotel was fine for me and the party of 12 who stayed, all said we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Agon changed to Ibis Styles, high value for money”
Reviews.Author: BalazsVegh
Reviews.Content: Close to Frankfurter Allee and U-bahn, renovated probably just a few years ago. Very friendly and helpful staff, WiFi and breakfast included (a recent policy in Ibis Styles hotels), room is neat, bed is comfortable, bathroom is clean. Parking in the court is possible, be careful when driving in through a very narrow corridor. Nice surprise, can highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and not too touristy”
Reviews.Author: JulietNW
Reviews.Content: We spent the first two nights as a couple and then our friend jointed us at the hotel for the remaining two nights at the end of November 2011. The hotel is very close to the station meaning you can get around very easily. It was clean and the staff were friendly enough. The main reason I picked this hotel was because of the price and hope that it would be in an interesting area, which it was. It seems as though the area is somewhere that real people live, which I hoped for as I knew I would spend all of my time exploring the touristy areas and wanted the chance to see somewhere off the beaten track. The shower was good and the room was really spacious. Decor was outdated, and TV small (with only news 24 in English) but this didn't bother us as we only really need the room for sleeping and showering! Our friend also stayed down the hall, and as we had a table with three chairs in our room, this made it handy for socializing. Rooms were very quiet so we slept well. We did see others walking around so I think the soundproofing worked well, rather than it being empty! We didn't sample the breakfast as it was typically German and not the kind of thing three English people like eating on a hangover! If you're looking for a decent priced hotel with good bathroom facilities located off the beaten track then I'd recommend. If you want a hotel with lots of facilities then I'd suggest going somewhere else, but for us this was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money - please get some double beds”
Reviews.Author: samrossuk
Reviews.Content: In a cool area of Berlin; ridiculously good value for money; friendly enough staff (they upgraded my room when I made it clear I wasn't that happy with the two single beds). Now been rebranded as an Ibis but that doesn't make too much of a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Took me nearly 2 years to get round to this!!”
Reviews.Author: Gav1968
Reviews.Content: As I said I'm not the quickest in writing reviews, however as I will be returning to the hotel in March 2012 I thought it only fair to write one!! The hotel for my mind is fantastic, clean, tidy, efficiently run by very friendly staff, the rooms are large with everything you need, plus a powerful shower that pins you against the wall on a morning!! Perfectly situated for the U-Bahn stop at Samariterstrasse just round the corner, and then onwards to Berlins fab transport system. The hotel is very well priced and I could imagine paying far more in Britain for far less quality, but I think ripping off the punters is a British thing. Its actually costing me a total of £150.00 less for 3 more days than my last trip, so the recession can't be used as an excuse to pump up the price of everything. My advice if you are visiting Berlin, is to stay here, you won't be disappointed, and it does exactly what it says on the tin. Roll on March 2012!!

Reviews.Title: “Far better than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: Miniist
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cheap place to stay in Berlin that wasn't a hostel. As I was travelling on my own I wanted a place that wasn't too far away from the U-bahn and that wasn't in a dodgy area or out in the sticks. Agon Frankfurter Allee ticked all the boxes and after all the positive reviews I booked myself a single room for 3 nights. The tube station is literally a 5min walk away and Frankfurter Allee is full of shops and places to eat. I was slightly worried about Kinzigstrasse at first as on the corner there is a shop that sells alcohol and there always people on the corner drinking alcohol (possibly homeless? as they were there all day and night) but I soon realised I had nothing to worry about. These people kept themselves to themselves and never bothered me at all (I am a young woman with blue hair so if anyone is going to get hassled it would be me lol!). Agon hotel is very nice and modern, I actually felt under dressed when checking in lol. The staff are really friendly and will answer any questions you may have. There is always someone on the reception too so no waiting around for ages to get info. I expected the room to be decent but it was better than expected! It was so clean it looked brand new! I was really impressed. The cleaners were really friendly and always folded up your towels neatly and made the bed to perfection. The bed was really comfy and warm, the radiators worked really well so was always nice and cosy. The shower is very powerful and gets really hot and more than enough space for luggage/clothes. There was also a tv with loads of free channels and lots of lamps so was nice and relaxing at night. Great location, very near to alexanderplatz so really easy to get into berlin. U5 was always working and on time. I definitely would recommend this hotel and will insist on staying here whenever I go to Berlin again! Fantastic :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, off the tourist track”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie P
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, with walking distance to a UBahn stops on 2 different lines; stone's throw to tons of restaurants and bars; walking distance to East Side Gallery/Berlin Wall. This area didn't feel touristy at all. Would highly recommend for location alone. The hotel was nice, staff were friendly. We had to switch rooms as the first room felt like a dorm room. The shower didn't have a basin, and you'd simply close the shower curtain to section off the corner of the bathroom. And although we had requested a non-smoking room, it was situated right over the smoking area in the courtyard. We had to pay for an upgrade to switch rooms, but it was worth it at that point. We stayed for 6 nights. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TiR_pt
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for stay 5 nights. The room was a bit small but very confortable, the staff is very kind and the breakfast is fantastic. Its very close to metro station and you can reach a lot of things by foot. If you want to go out at night there is nice bars in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Edgy Location at a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: piphoshin
Reviews.Content: The Agon Frankfurter Allee is located in a wonderful edgy location, close by numerous bars and restaurants. Its also close to a number of alternative shops (including Mondo's selling DDR memorabilia),piercing and tatoo palors, lots of graffiti, political rallys and sqats. An American guest only stayed one night claiming it was a culture shock, so that should give you a good appreciation of the area. The hotel is clean, efficient and comfortable; a little like an Ibis, nothing to rave about, but the price is great. Most of the other guests are German, apart from a few other Brits and the disgruntled American. Its located by Samariter Strasse U-Bahn on Frankfurter Allee, whihc means that most attractions need to be reached via Alexandreplatz, however, if you go south (past the trendy bars) you get to Warschauer Strasse (U and S Bahn) that gets you into central and west Berlin a lot quicker.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: MidlothianNar Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the third ime I have stayed at this hotel in the last four years. Each time I have found it to be excellent. The staff are very friendly and welcoming. Cannot fault the (single) rooms, they are confortable, of a good size, very clean with excellent facilities. The showers are particuarly good! Breakfast was a buffet style self service but very good indeed with plenty of choice. The hotel is in the former East Berlin, only 20 minutes or so by underground from Alexanderplatz. There are pleanty of restaurants, cafes, shops and bars nearby and the hotel is only a couple of minutes walk from Sameriterstrasse U-Bahn station (U5 line). Ideal for the S9 train from Schonefeld airport as this train stops at Frankfurter Allee station, the next one along on the U5 line. Although there were diversions due to track alterations when I stayed which caused a bit of a dely in reaching the hotel. There was no delay on the return journey though.

Reviews.Title: “Very odd rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ParkerPies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Agon Frankfurter Allee in May 2011, 2 couples. Good points were that the reception was friendly and efficient, the breakfast was good and the hotel is within easy distance of the U-bahn. On the negative side, there is no bar as such, they just serve from reception, so there's not much in the way of facilities here. The rooms were very odd - we booked two doubles but were given 2 twinsinstead. One room was enormous with two bathrooms including a disabled-access one, with two rooms sections with a single bed in each. Next door the second room was tiny, it was so small that the beds were end to end along the wall rather than side by side! This might be fine for friends, backpackers etc but not for couples! There was enough space for one person to walk between the beds and the wardrobe and dressing table, but not two people. The room was clean though, as was the bathroom. The rooms smelled of smoke though, rather offputtting for a set of non-smokers. Would we go back? Yes for location, no unless we had better rooms. My advice is to check the room before you unpack and don't hesitate to go back and get a better one if you need to!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem, would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Josie0007
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late in from the airport and it was so nice to first easily find the hotel, have a friendly reception and then find a lovely clean, and very spacious (including a HUGE bathroom compared to both European city hotels we've been in) room. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is in a quiet area so we managed to have a great sleep. It is excellently located as it's only a minute or 2 walk from an underground station so easy to get around, including late at night. The buffet breakfast is good, a lot of choice and different options, and it varied slightly on our 2 days. The hot water pressure is amazing. Great value for money. Would definitely recommend it to people and would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “convenient sightseeing base- would use this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: HVA01
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was ideal for a budget sightseeing break. Sameriterstrasse U-bahn station is just 2 mins walk round the corner in this up-and-coming, characterful district of East Berlin. This is four stops from Alexanderplatz, home of the impressive TV tower and cafes, bars, shops, as well as ideal transport hub providing easy access to the rest of Berlin (bus, train and tram connections). Bus goes from Alexanderplatz to Tegel airport every ten minutes. The hotel was simple but spotless. It stands on a quirky courtyard in an authentic studenty/hippy/punk (!) area, where we felt safe, even at night (don't be put off by the graffiti). Reception staff were helpful. We breakfasted at the cheap but fantastic bakery/coffee shop over the road and sampled a couple of neighbourhood pubs. Great value for money. Being a bit off the normal tourist track was great! We felt like we saw a real slice of Berlin life.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: Annione
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a very nice stay here, 4 nights in april. It is near Samaritastrasse, the U-bahn st. and from there it takes 10 minuts to Alexander Platz. Very quiet - we were in room 108, facing the backyard. Nice beds, nice shower, nice cleaning, good but simple service. I would stay here again. The wifi was 9 Euro for 24 hours. Didn't use it. In the reception you can use a pc (internet) for free!

Reviews.Title: “Long walk to city center, but close to public transportation”
Reviews.Author: Noellcakes
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel AGON Frankfurter Allee in June 2010 with my husband, and a friend. Our car had GPS so the hotel was easy to find. Our friend that traveled with us is from Germany, so we were lucky enough to have a German speaking person with us to help with the reservations. Our rooms were ready when we arrived. We booked two rooms - one with a queen bed for my husband and I, and a second room with a single bed for our friend. The price was very fair for being located in such a large city as Berlin. The rooms were clean, as well as the bathrooms. Our room was very large, while the single room was very small. There was an elevator, however we did not use it as our rooms were on the 2nd floor and we didn't feel the need to use it. The hotel is located on a quiet-ish street. We were not bothered by loud cars or traffic. It is also located relatively close to public transportation, however, the trains only run until certain times, so we walked most of the time. It's a very long walk to the city center, but we enjoyed the long walks. Also included free breakfast. Yum. Very good selection, as we found out that almost all hotels in Germany had great free breakfast. We basically just used the hotel for a place to sleep, and didn't spend a lot of time there, so it was perfect for us. Would I recommend this hotel to other people? Sure. Will I stay here again in the future - possibly. Nothing to complain about, except the key chain was HUGE and very heavy, so as not to lose it or steal it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, near metro system.”
Reviews.Author: farout75
Reviews.Content: The Agon Frankfurter Allee is virtually hidden in an area only a block off Frankfurter Allee and a five minute U-Bahn ride from Alexander Platz. The neighborhood has interesting cafes and good supermarkets within easy walking. The rooms are spartan but impeccably clean. We had a larger "comfort room" as the smaller "classic rooms" were already booked. We had friends who did get one of the smaller rooms and we found them to be quite comfortable and adequately large. The lobby area is informal and appealing with a bar located adjacent to the reception with the clerk having to serve as bartender! The staff were all friendly and helpful. The breakfast offered was 8 euros additional, so we opted to go across the street to have our breakfast each day at the corner bakery where a complete breakfast was available at a price of 4.75 euros. This was big enough for two with enough left for a "take-out lunch." Coffee or tea was one euro. Overall, the Agon Frankfurt Allee was a good choice for convenience, value, and comfort for the traveler who does not require being in the dead center of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A great, convenient budget option”
Reviews.Author: elliem81
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here, mainly because it was so convenient for travelling into the centre of Berlin (only a few minutes walk from the underground station) and the area around the hotel was great for getting a cheap meal or a drink in the evening. The rooms are basic but clean, spacious and they have everything you're likely to need. We requested a double room but got two single beds at opposite sides of the room. However, this was the only negative aspect of our stay. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the free internet was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Position”
Reviews.Author: patdad
Reviews.Content: I'd just like to endorse the other positive reports. We spent 5 days here last week and the hotel was exactly as described. We actually spent very little time in it, as we tended to leave after breakfast and arrive back around 12 hours later, but it's welcoming, clean, warm and you get a good breakfast. You wouldn't want to spend a lot of time in your bedroom, but the twin beds were comfy and the large shower was powerful, so what more can you expect for such cheap prices? We'd stay there again if we go back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem...”
Reviews.Author: Kanterla
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from staying at this hotel. From the outset the service was great. We checked in a little earlier than allowed, without fuss and we even moved rooms without a problem. The breakfast buffet is great. Lots of choice (I recommend the scrambled egg!) and decent value. It would be great if they served snacks or dinner on the basis of this. The rooms are not bad in size. They are impeccably clean as well. Though they are basic. They tend to be two single beds pushed together. And thus have single blankets plus a couple of throws stored in the cupboards. They are warm though. Which was great taking in to account the weather there at present! It was freezing! Closeby there is the u-bahn to alexanderplatz. From there you can go pretty much anywhere. Similarly it's easy to get to from the airport. There are pharmacies, newsagents and places to eat in walking distance too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget option”
Reviews.Author: Eggo1984 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I paid £40 a night for a double room. This included an amazing buffet breakfast each morning as well. The hotel was warm, clean and the staff were great. I have no complaints at all. They had free internet (10mins a go sort of thing) and let you print for nothing which was handy for maps etc. The staff had a good knowledge of tourist activities in Berlin and the location was spot on too. Only a few minutes’ walk form the nearest U-bahn and in quite a quirky district with good/cheap bars and food. I fully recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cyclaades
Reviews.Content: Great staff, very helpful, clean hotel and a few meters from the U-Bahn (Metro) station. Excellent breakfast was included in the rate we paid. My wife and myself with my son and his family stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and there was nothing I could fault the hotel on. I only thing I have to complain about is the Berlin Welcome Card it's a rip off and I would advise people to think twice before they buy one as it excludes most of the main tourist attractions like most of these tourist cards do. It is useful as a bus/train ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Great Winter Stay in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: RayRPCV
Reviews.Content: Berlin is really something special, and this hotel meets everything you need to enjoy this beautiful city. Personally, we love staying closer to locals in the outskirts of a town to experience the local life... If you don't know anyone in Berlin, staying in a hotel such as this one will show you how nice Germany keeps their hotels, and the subway is cheap and conveniently close to this hotel. No matter where you stay, you will see how beautiful this city has become... We stayed her in the cold winter, and it was one of our most romantic getaways in all our travels. Alexandar Platz and everything else is just a hop, skip, and a jump away from this hotel and East Berlin, where this hotel resides, has won us over! By the way, Berlin is one of the most valued vacation spots. Everything is reasonably priced for the Eurozone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: mrswhapples
Reviews.Content: There are some good deals for this hotel, we paid £48 per night for a double room for 2 nights. 4 couples away for a weekend break. I have been to Berlin 2x before and stayed in different areas, but this was the best. Don't be put off by graffitti - it is all over Berlin! good travel links. Room was basic, but nice and clean - actually our room (102) wasn't great with no bedside cabinets and an awkward shape, but bed (2 singles pushed together) was comfortable and the room clean and functional - our friends room was a much better layout )with sofa desk etc), so ask for a proper shaped room. It didn't matter though, we spent little time in the room. Reception open 24 hours, nice and clean, had a beer in the bar area. Breakfast adequate - big spread, 7-10 but you need to be there by 9.40 to get sausages, eggs, etc, lots of cheese, rolls, cereal etc. Lots of good bars, pubs, restaurants nearby. A great location, would recommend the Jewish memorial museum by Brandenberg gate and going up the TV tower (but get there 'early' to avoid queues - 11am is fine)

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but ticks all the boxes...”
Reviews.Author: Viajante-BRUK
Reviews.Content: Firstly when I arrived I was kind of scared of the location but later I found out that was a sort of cultural place, nearby there are a lot of nice restaurants and the hotel is really close to the metro station. The hotel room is very basic but comfortable with a very nice breakfast and affordable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice location”
Reviews.Author: DCH47
Reviews.Content: The Agon Frankfurter Allee is a small hotel in a renovated old building. It is not fancy by any means, but it is clean, quiet, and comfortable and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Our room was adequate but a bit small for three people ... my adult son had to sleep on a cot squeezed into a corner. The included breakfast was excellent, with both hot and cold entries served buffet style. As mentioned, the staff was great, and the hotel was located only two or three blocks from the u-bahn, with easy connections to all of Berlin's excellent public transportation system. There were several restaurants and bars nearby, so finding something to eat was not a problem either. There is a computer in the lobby with free internet access but no wi-fi. If you're expecting the Hilton or Marriott, this is not the place for you. But if you're looking for value, convenience, and friendly staff you should definetly check it out. We enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel location”
Reviews.Author: wavyhorses
Reviews.Content: Flew to Berlin for the beer festival (also very good) Hotel close to underground. Good breakfest buffet included. Surrounding area looked a bit rough but no problems even late at night it was safe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: katebuk1
Reviews.Content: Lovely friendly welcoming and clean. Staff all spoke English and were keen to help out. Rooms were lovely and had everything we needed, quite location but very central for transport i.e U Bahn and S Bahn within walking distance. Plenty of things to do in the surrounding area also within walking distance Comfortable beds and pleasant breakfast

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for a short stay,so close to train into Berlin”
Reviews.Author: enfieldlady
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at hotel,dont be put off by the area,grafffitti everywhere, its all over Berlin, hotel great for a short stay,clean room,big selection for b'fast,cereal,fruit,cheese,meats. We did'nt have a car but noticed that parking was 8 euros in the hotel courtyard..the hotel also hires out bikes 12euros a day..sooo many people ride bikes in Berlin,.train station only a few minutes away,loads of restaurants just a few streets away,we mostly eat in Kuchenrausch,lovely food,good service and inexpensive.the area is mainly populated by young people,but we felt safe and welcomed.everybody speaks English,so no need for a phrasebook.!

Reviews.Title: “I thoroughly recommend the Hotel Agon, you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TUPSJEO
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent 5 days at The Hotel Agon. It was good value for money and location wise it is situated right in the heart of the old East Berlin. The area may look a bit shabby as there are a number of squats and communes but this adds to the areas vibrancy. The nearest U-Bahn is a 5 minute stroll and it's 5 stops to Alexanderplatz. Breakfast was included and was a good spread typical of the continent. 10 minute walk away is Simon Dach strasse where you will find lots of cheap bars and cafes and eateries and a very vibrant scene. Having stayed in Mitte last year i far preferred this end of the city and this hotel reprsented great value and a good base to explore from.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a lovely quarter”
Reviews.Author: Sunman_c_
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in Friedrichshain, one of Eastern Berlins "Kiez"-Quarters, which means the quarter is buzzing with a grown community as well as with multinational influences and loads of snuggly cafes, stylish restaurants and strange little shops. The service is solid, the breakfast good and the connection to the citycenter via the metro is fast. While in the area look for the greatest cafe there, the "Kuchenrausch"

Reviews.Title: “Handy for u bahn”
Reviews.Author: citybreaker20
Reviews.Content: comfortable hotel friendly staff good breakfast perfect base for city break

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality”
Reviews.Author: LudensPJ
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agon is not a special hotel. There is nothing exceptional about the way they do things. But they do everything you expect, and they do it well. The hotel is in a good location, quiet and at a reasonable distance to the city centre. The rooms are spacious, clean, and a bit dull, but everything's there. We did not make any special demands so I cannot comment on the quality of service, but checking in and out went smoothly. A more adventurous travel may consider the hotel as lacking flair, but for someone just wanting a place to say I can definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “a tremendous value in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: hoosierz
Reviews.Content: While the neighborhood may appear to be a bit seedy, This hotel is a great value in an otherwise expensive city for hotels. In addition to a good, clean room, there is a friendly, helpful staff, and a bountiful breakfast bar. Guest also enjoy unlimited use of the free internet in the lobby. I was quite pleased with my 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: gwenann
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. Plenty of choice for breakfast. A clean, warm hotel with helpful staff. Stayed for 3 nights -sheets changed once and towels daily. Close to the undereground linking the hotel to city centre. Would return again for another holiday.

Reviews.Title: “poor roomservice not so clean expesive internet service”
Reviews.Author: omida100
Reviews.Content: I stayed there three nights never got a change of sheets no clean towels ,the answer to my inquiries was we forgot.......??????? For Internet services they charge 13 EUR / a day ( everywhere else it's gratis ) Very bad service, never again .

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ReneandRenato
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of December. We found the hotel through laterooms.com and paid a total of £64, which included a buffet breakfast . We read the positive reviews on tripadvisor before arriving so kind of expected something that was going to be okay. Our expections were however exceeded since we found the hotel, rooms, staff and breakfasts to be EXCELLENT. We would most definitely use this hotel again when we next visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Best budget deal in berlin”
Reviews.Author: travelindave45
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for $50/night(non-refundable) for a double in early November. Rooms are a bit institutional (no padding under new carpet, could easily imagine mental patient being hosed down in shower) but are huge by European standards and spotless. Great hot water and water pressure (see previous remark), new mattresses. Excellent breakfast, free internet, CNN/BBC. Located 200m from Samiter ter metro, 4-5 stops (8 minutes) from Alexanderplatz (short walk to Museum Island), from which you can be anywhere in central Berlin in 10 minutes. Eastside Gallery is a long but doable walk (2 km or so) Located in (seemingly very safe) working class neighborhood. Staff will tell you that there are "more than 170 restaurants and clubs" in a nearby quadrangle about 1/2 mile from hotel , but most of these are bars; found 6-8 restaurants during short walk, most of them Indian/Turkish. You may have to get on metro if you want wide choice of non-ethnic food, although I will admit to not haaving made a comprehensive tour of the area. Good pastry shop on corner, Highly recommended if you want immaculately clean, inexpensive, reasonably located hotel with good breakfast. This was a steal at the price I paid

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkRobo
Reviews.Content: With a buget in mind I chose this Hotel for the cost, we stayed there for 5 nights, we had a lovely room on the 4th floor serviced by the lift close to the reception area. The Hotel was very close to the u bahn (Underground station) which made it easy to get around once we had mastered the underground system. Our room was very clean and was serviced every day. All the TV programmes were in German but enjoyed watching the endless tv adverts, so take a portable dvd player if you cannot speak German. Breakfast was served until 10am so it was nice to have a lie in some days,and although busy most mornings we always managed to get a table, the selection of food on offer was far more than anticipated with cereals/ fruit/ cheeses and hams even boiled and scrambled eggs with ample amounts of tea and coffee. The staff were very helpful and there is a free internet service for checking out any places of interest you may be thinking of visiting, We paid a visit to the Sacsenhausen Concentration Camp, sombre but interesting. To sum up the Agon Frankfurter Allee hotel was great value for money and I would highly reccomend. Ken Robinson and Kevin Mitchelson. If you are going the following directions may be helpful - take the U Bahn 5 out of Alexanderpalatz to Samariterstrasse - walk in the direction of the train to the exit - take the first right and then the first left - the hotel is immediately around the corner

Reviews.Title: “berlin”
Reviews.Author: Simon1888
Reviews.Content: the agon frankfurter allee is a very pleasant hotel . with the added benefits of being close to most of the main attractions in the city . staff were wonderfully helpful to me as i have little or no german . all in all very good value for money . and i would recommend it to anyone wishing to stay in berlin

Reviews.Title: “Basic Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joesuef
Reviews.Content: Very basic - but clean, and good breakfast. No frills. About 5 stops away from major train station so a little out of the way. If price is a factor and you don't mind an extra 15 minutes on the train - this is an okay place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: DanishTurist
Reviews.Content: The location is quiet, in the Fredrichsheim, that means that you have to take the u bahn 5 stops for reaching alexander palatz, with connections to the bigger sights in Berlin. But then you get a quiet part of town, with lot of trees and air, and a lot of small restaurants, and if you want to walk , then just walk straight on, and you end in the center, via Frankfurter alle and Karl Marx str. The hotel itself has just renovated the bathrooms, and they are big, bright and with big showercabin and good lightning. The breakfast room is also newly renovated. The rooms it self is simple but funktionel, but as always with carpets, that looks more dirty than they properly are. The beakfast was a fine surprise, very large choise, and egg made by order, fresh bread, diary products and a lot to put on it. Around the corner is small shops selling what you could need in a late evening, and a lot of take away, and cheap restaurants. Everywhere was there to much to shop!, the most surprisingly places. KDW had late sale, and small strange had tings that could be amzing christmas presents - even though its just september!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Sufficient, clean and peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: Oi
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It’s a short one and a half block from the U-bahn (it looks longer on the map but there’s actually a very closer entrance). The area is great also. There’s a park nearby. A Sunday street fair takes place there, which is very lively. You find crafts, antiques, and all sorts of things. There are many restaurants, bars, and cafes nearby, and yet the hotel sits on a quiet/peaceful block (I also asked for a room facing the back which made the experience even more peaceful). The neighborhood might not look fancy but it felt very safe. If you are familiar with New York City, it felt like the grungy East Village before the yuppies took over. The room is very basic. It’s small but completely sufficient and clean. There’s a computer near the check-in counter for free internet use. The buffet breakfast is nice. You can’t really have anything to complain about. I paid 48 Euro/night (late June 2009) for a single room with a single bed—used booking.com. I would be happier to pay less (since the exchange rate was bad for me). That’s all.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!! SO CLEAN, FRIENDLY& POLITE STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: usaf_babe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel June 7- 10 and absolutely enjoyed it. I found it very relaxing, CLEAN!!!!, and comfortable! The staff spoke very good english and was beyond friendly. I had a issue on the 3rd night with a child running & jumping above our room (while I was trying to sleep) I notified the staff and the situation was handled immediately. The bathroom was VERY large & super clean- looked like it had never been used before!! The bed in the room was 2 beds pushed together under 1 headboard but it was very comfortable. TV in the room had both english and german channels. I also enjoyed the HUGE window in the room that opened to let in fresh air! We paid 24 Euros (total) for 3 nights parking inside the SECURE private car park inside the courtyard of the hotel (with security cameras.) There was no WAYYYY I was parking on the side of the street, I was worried if I would have tires on my car the next morning or if my car would be spray painted in graffitti! Despite the rough looking neighborhood the hotel was AMAZING and I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Best deal ever!”
Reviews.Author: Raluca L
Reviews.Content: The best price I have ever payed for a double room with breakfast included- only 35 E. The room was not so big but it was very clean and cozy. There were also bigger rooms. My sister payed 65 euros for a huge dbl room. The breakfast and the stuff were also ok and the distance from the hotel to the metro station was very short.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western City Est choice (moved here due to double booking)”
Reviews.Author: Cressida
Reviews.Content: Located on a backstreet (entrance via alley way), about 5 minutes walk from Samariterstrasse u-bahn. Our rooms were quite small and reminiscent of hostel accommodation, but were clean and tidy and the beds are comfortable. Unfortunately, we didn't get much sleep to due to both the internal and external noise (one room backed onto the internal courtyard, where any kind of noise was greatly amplified, the other onto the road). Continental breakfast was available, with plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for this money”
Reviews.Author: jakubik
Reviews.Content: Originally my wife and I booked a hostel room for 75Euro (no bathroom), but later I figured out that for this money we could find a decent hotel. So we did. The Agon was great for the money (by booking via the hotel webpage we ended up with 55Euro/room/night with breakfast). The hotel is new, so everything worked well and looked new. Our room was large enough to accomodate both the bed and a large sofa. I like this hotel for the building- an old brick building in a quiet street. The disadvantage is the 5 metro-stops away from Alexander Platz. If you can live with it, then this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot to enjoy Berlin from.”
Reviews.Author: CaligulaLimerick
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely clean hotel that is only around the block from the U-bhan station which puts the whole of berlin at your feet. Its location in the east of berlin maybe in a more run down area but alot of east berlin is like that however it did feel safe and at no time did any of us feel we needed to get out of there. The hotel is spotless and the staff feel friendly enough. the rooms are basic and provide everything you need including very comfortable beds. The only down side we found to the hotel was the claimed to have a 24 hour bar but this was really the receiption desk and while we were there the bar was closed, but besides that for the price this is one of the best 3 stars I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic 3 star hotel- if you get a good price..”
Reviews.Author: vaggos
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel, with decent breakfast, quiet(I dont know for the hotter days with open windows). The area is not so good but nobody bothered us.5 minutes from underground. Beds and pillows not very comfortable, and had no choice.Wireless internet is not free. It's a basic 3 star hotel, and I think its not worth the basic price-around 60 per night. For this money you can get better. If you get a better price( I had 28 euros per night through yeego.com) it is recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: gatsouni
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Agon Frankfureter Allee for 5 nights - from 7th to 12th February. The overall impression was more than satisfying: clean and spacious room, nice reception, above average breakfast. The best with this hotel is its location - that is, a 5 minutes walk from Simon Dach strasse, which is the main street in Friedrichschain for a drink and dinner. "Meyman" and "Cafe 100 Wasser" are less than 500 meters from the hotel, in the corner (20 meters from the hotel) is a mini market, the U-bahn (Samariterstrasse)m is situated no more than 150 meters away....It really made our staying more comfortable, I'd suggest it to anyone planning to stay in Friedrichschain!!!! If you consider that we paid 25 euros per night, I'd said it was the best value for money hotel I've ever stayed in.......

Reviews.Title: “Glad we gone to the Agon”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBernards
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided us with an excellent base for a fabulous long weekend in Berlin. The nearest U-bahn station is about a five minute walk from the hotel. Our room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. We found the staff at reception to be friendly and helpful. We got on very well with the bear out the front too. There was a good spread at breakfast. It got a bit cramped at busy times, but we always managed to get a table. There were a few good restaurants within a few minutes of the hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: Dolphin028
Reviews.Content: I've just returend from a 4-night stay at the hotel, and would certainly recomend it to anyone. The hotel is clean, and the staff are friendly enough. There is a variety of choice for Breakfast - meats, cheeses, cereals, bread rolls, fruit as well as tea, coffee and fruit juices. The hotel's nearest U-Bahn train station is only a couple of minutes walk away, and is approx. 5 stops from Alexanderplatz which seems to be one of the most central areas of the city. There is a TV tower in Alexanderplatz; for 9 euro 50, you can go up to the cafe, which is worth doing, you can see for miles. It is worthwhile getting to the tower early, however, as there is generally a queue. It was our third time in Berlin [the second at Frankfurter Alee Hotel], so had seen the 'touristy bits' ie Checkpoint Charlie before but it was great to still walk around -must have walked miles every day. all in all, it was a great stay, and would certainly consider going to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but noisy on the street side”
Reviews.Author: SigiL
Reviews.Content: We just come back for a 2 night stay in this hotel. As many other people said, it is nice & clean, even if poor deco wise. I really liked the Friedrichain area, with nice places (and surprinsingly very cheap) to eat & drink. If you stay here, ask for a room that is NOT located on the street side as it is very noisy!!! There is a bar in front & also alcoholic people right at the corner (they might even sleep there as far as I know, I have seen them there any time : they are not dangerous though). They are shouting & yelling at each other in the middle of the night... And if you are noise sensitive, forget about it without earplugs... Apart from the above, our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel and ideal sight seeing base...”
Reviews.Author: stang78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years ago one Christmas and loved it. Returning to Berlin for part of our mini-honeymoon in the summer, we wanted something cheap but clean and Agon Frankfurter Allee fit the bill for the three night stay. The Samariterstrasse U-bahn station is about a minute's walk from the hotel. This then goes straight into Alexanderplatz, which is one of the major transport hubs in Berlin; from here the S-bahn and U-bahn lines for the whole of city are accessible. Trains from Samariterstrasse depart every 5 minutes until very late on. For this reason, it is an ideal sight-seeing base - I never find the need to pay a great deal for a hotel which we only sleep at, but I always insist on it being clean. The room was spotless and the bathroom looked brand-new. The breakfast is fanastic considering it is included in the already very reasonable price. Bread, eggs scrambled and boiled, different cold meats, cereal, yoghurt etc. It really provides an excellent start to a day's sightseeing. The hotel's environs aren't the best looking - but we never felt threatened or menaced, either on the previous visit or last week's. The area is probably undergoing a regeneration of sorts, but I actually found myself liking the character of the place. Grafiti is present, but that's Berlin (and most capital cities) for you. The hotel itself is very secure and well maintained. Lastly, the staff are very friendly and do speak English, although I usually try and speak German just to show that I'm making an effort! Overall, a little gem of an hotel. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhillgal
Reviews.Content: Whilst this is not completely central (2 tube journeys from the main station), this hotel was ideal for a short stay in Berlin. It is only a few minutes walk from the nearest U-Bahn station (Samariterstrasse) and was very easy to find. Rooms were clean, breakfast was lovely (vanilla custard - yum!!) and it was ideally located for the bars, restaurants and nightlife of Friedrichshain. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable, value for money stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel & good location”
Reviews.Author: cutedarcy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in April 08. Lovely hotel, close to transport system, about 5 min walk. Room was spotless, breakfast was good also. We stayed in room no 7, across the courtyard, good size and bathroom fine. Staff friendly though the price of alcohol in the bar is more expensive compared with other places. Also, bottled water from reception is €3 and the local shop cost is €1.30. Overall, good hotel, good location and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: MissWales82
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, close to transport and restaurants. Very clean room and nice breakfast. Only complaint was we got woken up at 5am every morning from noise coming from the hotel back yard area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: D-TAdventures
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I would like to mention that booking this hotel through their own website will save you 5%, which they deduct from your final bill upon checkout....a really nice surprise on top of an extraordinary stay. We did our research on this site and decided to take a "chance" in east Berlin where this hotel is located.....NO ISSUES WHATSOEVER. If you're the type of traveller that doesn't enjoy getting out and getting a feel for the people and your surroundings, then perhaps a little dog poop on the street or some grafitti will deter you from this location, but we thought the area was cozy and easy to get to and from for all of the touristy stuff. There is also a great street (so sorry for forgetting the name of the street but if you walk out of the hotel, make a right and turn left at the first street and walk until you find all the bars and restaurants...you can't miss it) about a 10 minute walk from the hotel that we ate at twice in 4 days....highly reccommend: "euphoria" (I think it was called) was a restaurant with a huge patio and really good food that we ate at the first night we arrived. I had also heard on this site that if you had a "special" request for a larger room, it may be granted at the regular price.....it was great to discover that after asking for a larger room, if available, that they compensated with an apartmtent (equipped with two bathrooms and a small kitchen) at no extra charge. Absolutely perfect! Breakfast was good, but we opted for a german platter breakfast at one of the many restaurants serving there on our last day at Herkescher Markt...so huge, but a beautiful display of fruit, breads, meats and cheeses. Overall, a great stay...and if we ever turn up in Berlin again, we will definitely book at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, not-so-clean neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Tauberman
Reviews.Content: Hotel was spotlessly clean although bedrooms are very functional (certainly not a room to relax in) and meant for sleeping in only. We had the basic double room which meant twin beds pushed together with one against the wall. Breakfast was very good - typical of type of hotel in Germany. Excellent restaurant in Plaza on nearby Frankfurter Allee and great link into city on U5 from Samariterstrasse station. Super access to Schoenefeld airport by S-bahn (change at Treptower Park) to/from Frankfurter Allee station (walk to hotel from there - not worth going onto ubahn for the one stop) for 2.50 Euros (ticket for BC area or 2.80 for ABC area if you drop your bags and go straight into the city or use U5 for the one stop). Handy little shop next door to hotel and excellent shopping at Ring Centre by Frankfurter Allee station. Neighbourhood streets are seedy (watch where you put your feet!) but area is getting better. Would certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: emaRome
Reviews.Content: I spent here the 1st May weekend. The hotel has a smart location, in a quiet street and 2-minute walk away from the Samariterstr. U-bahn station (line U-5). The room was quite simple and essential but really clean. The hotel was quiet at night, even if it was more or less sold out. The staff is kind and English speaking. The only (very partial) minuses regard breakfast: the breakfast canteen is quite congested when the hotel is full and the food choice could be a little richer, but I'm not saying at all the breakfast was bad or scarce.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to explore Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Barrie96
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here and found the hotel lived up to the reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel stands out in the street as a modern place among some more run-down properties, but it's very close to Frankfurter Allee. Tip: the closest underground station is Samariterstrasse - only 2 minutes walk away. We had a lovely spacious room - double bed, table, couch, etc and a bright en-suite bathroom. Everything was spotless. For breakfast there was plenty of choice - fruit juice, cereals, bread, rolls, fruit, yogurt, cold meat, cheese, boiled eggs, a scrambled egg dish with bacon, jam, tea, coffee. In short all you'd want before setting off for a day's sightseeing. There was also free computer access and a little bar, which we didn't use. The staff were friendly and helpful. We'd have no hesitation in returning here the next time we go to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Buster7456
Reviews.Content: Just back after 4 day stay in Berlin. Read reviews and choose hotel accordingly. Not disappointed good basic accommodation at budget price for Berlin. Staff were helpful, metro around corner - loads of eating houses within 5 to 10 min walking time. Room was clean and the little breakfast was ample Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: traveluva
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on price and reviews and I wasnt disappointed. The price was good for the location. It is located close to Frankfurter Allee S-Bahn Station and there is also a U-Bahn station nearby. It is also possible to walk to Alexandraplatz from the hotel but it is easier to take public transport! The area itself is fine. The hotel is located off a busy street on a quieter side street so there are no problems with noise at night. Some people may be put off by the grafiti in the immediate vicinity... but you have to remember this is Berlin and Berlin especially former East Berlin is covered in grafiti! Berlin in general is a safe city. I have never felt unsafe at any time of the day or night. There is a shopping centre a short walk from the hotel as well and loads of places to eat for cheap locally. The rooms are clean, bright and spacious. The same with the bathroom. The room was cleaned every day and new towels were provided. There is no hairdryer in the room and if you need one then you have to get one at reception but you will need to leave a €10 deposit... they will give this back to you when you return the hairdryer. There is free internet in reception and the free breakfast buffet is fab. You have to leave your key in reception when you leave which was fine with us as we would rather this than have to worry about where we put our keys. Over all I enjoyed my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Date 29 feb 2008”
Reviews.Author: CocoGA
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from berlin and found the agon perfect for a stay, ideal for getting around if you get the u bahn from Samariterstrasse ( 2 mins up the road) to alexandraplatz you can then get anywhere you want to by tram, bus,or rail,get a welcome card it is well worth the money and has a very useful booklet with it. We had a twin room, not huge but decor good and everywhere very clean (you only sleep in it). Breakfast superb- what a choice and staff very helpful. There is a shop on the corner if you turn right out of hotel where you can buy cheap beer, snacks etc. Some nice restuarants nearby too, try Leander and also a bit further away one called Plus minus nil. Would recommend this hotel to anyone it is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Cathnix
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for the 3rd time in December 2007.Nice big room,very clean, excellent breakfast and very friendly and helpful staff. Close to the underground it's a great base for getting to the city centre. There are plenty of shops, restaurants and bars close by .We will be back later this year. It's a little gem. Mrs Catherine Nixon. Ilkley West Yorkshire.

Reviews.Title: “A Big City Bargain Despite the Seedy Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Gluhwein
Reviews.Content: I tried for months and months to score a bargain hotel through Priceline, but no one was willing to sell me a double room in Berlin for under $80 per night. I heard about Bookingbuddy.com and after painstaking searching I stumbled upon this hotel. I was a little nervous about giving the Istanbul-based GTA travel my credit card to confirm the room, but finding no major complaints about them on other websites, I went ahead and confirmed. (I have since found that they are all over Europe with their hotel and tour packages as well as bus charters) Getting to the Agon Frankfurter Allee can be a little challenging, but if you buy the Berlin WelcomeCard you can travel on all modes of transportation throughout the city. We simply wheeled our bags to the transport office's desk at Tegel Airport where we purchased our WelcomeCards. It was just a few steps to the TXL bus which took us to the Alexanderplatz U-Bahn stop. From there we went 4 steps via the subway to Samaritarstrasse. The Agon is just a block over from the main street. We were a little disappointed at the graffitti-scrawled neighborhood we found ourselves in. The surrounding buildings were stark remnants of the Communist period - totally devoid of charm. The hotel was not marked with much in the way of signage, but we gravitated toward the newest, cleanest looking building which turned-out to be the hotel. The hotel itself was a complete contrast to the rundown, but safe neighborhood - the rooms were big by European standards with overly fluffy pillows and warm comforters. Bathroom facilities were new, well-supplied and very clean. For the two very cold Berlin nights that we visited, our room was toasty and featured satellite TV with CNN and BBC in English. The hotel is on a backstreet so noise was never a problem. A nice-sized elevator allowed us to bring our bags up the three flights of stairs to our room and back down to the basement breakfast room. Breakfast was fantastic. A generous buffet featuring fresh fruit and rolls. There were piles of cold cuts and cheese to create heaping sandwiches. Soft-boiled and scrambled eggs. Hot and cold cereals. Coffee, tea and hot chocolate. Even the pseudo orange juice wasn't too bad. I highly recommend this hotel. I would suggest that you either drive yourself here (ample parking for a fee inside the hotel courtyard) or be sure you arrange to start your trip at this hotel. We never would have been able to lug our souvenir laden suitcases up to the subway, then across Alexanderplatz to the bus stop at the end of our trip. Finally, don't let the fact that the neighborhood seems a bit worn. We felt perfectly safe. The locals were very helpful when we asked directions and shopped at the next-door corner grocery.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ferdinando_pucci
Reviews.Content: It's a very comfortable hotels, very cheap with breakfast included. Beds can be joined to simulate a double. You can control the temperature in the room, the baths are new and have liquid soap. The hotel is very close to the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel”
Reviews.Author: edge_wife
Reviews.Content: My husband an I stayed here when I took him to Berlin for his birthday. We had a fabulous time: the hotel was clean, comfortable and the staff were helpful. It is tucked away a little bit but there's plenty of nearby shops, restaurants and bars. We were fairly new to travelling at the time and were fairly proud of ourselves for making it from Tegel on the bus and U-Bahn, thought it did test my schoolgirl German a bit. Loved every minute of our stay though and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in eastern Berlin”
Reviews.Author: bbwn82
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant in booking this hotel, given its off the beaten path location. However, it was an excellent surprise! The hotel was close to the S-bahn station Frankfurter Allee (5-10 minute walk), and was even closer to the U-bahn station (2 minutes). You can get anywhere you'd like to go downtown within 15 or 20 minutes. When we arrived at the hotel, we were pleasantly surprised by the size of our rooms, and the amenities such as the heated tile bathroom floor. Also, the breakfast was the best we have had at a European hotel with a full hot and cold buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: nicolah3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Agon for four nights in November. Despite there being a strike, we managed to get from Schoenefeld to the hotel with ease (using the S9 train which didn't take as long as anticipated based on previous reviews). The hotel was a great base for the City Centre, with the nearest U Bahn stop (Samariterstrasse) at the end of the next street. It takes less than 10 mins on U5 to get from there to Alexander Platz which we found to be an excellent base for the 4 days. All trains/buses to the usual tourist attractions went from there and getting around the city was unbelievably easy. We got the 72 Hour Welcome Card which included a booklet with discounts on lots of the tourist places (inc DDR Museum, Checkpoint Charlie Museum, Berlin Store to name but a few). We booked a double room and found it to be spacious and immaculate every day. The hotel staff were very friendly and spoke good English. Breakfast was included in our very reasonable price for the stay and there were many options available each morning. Cold meats, cheese, cereal, yoghurts, muesli etc - if you want a fry up, you're in the wrong country but cakes for breakfast was an added bonus! There were ample shops and restaurants in the vicinity however as it was so easy to get into the City Centre up until midnight, we ate out in town every night. The area by the hotel is well lit and we felt completely safe walking around at night. There is a great shop on the corner of Kinzigstrasse which sells everything from snacks to extremely cheap alcohol. We've never seen large bottles of Becks so cheap!!! The staff were also very friendly. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed the stay at the Agon and would definitely refer our friends there and would stay again. Don't be put off by the location as it really is very easy and quick to get into the City Centre. Trains going every 5 mins except on a Sunday when they're every 10 mins!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Devon
Reviews.Content: I wasn't quite sure about the hotel when I booked it. I booked it on the basis of the good reviews here and was impressed on arrival. The staff are good, breakfast is more than adequate, even though the breakfast area has the feel of a university canteen about it. The bar area is small but I never saw anyone using it during my stay. The room I had overlooked the car park at the back of the hotel, it was comfortable and clean although would not have been suitable for a couple (twin beds toe to toe). The hotel itself certainly stood out in the area, it's been renovated and looks a little out of place in a run down part of the old East Berlin. But the area is perfectly safe, and within easy reach of Samaritser Strasse U-bahn station. Yes, there are hotels with a better location in relation to the city centre, but this is a good hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: claretnale
Reviews.Content: We had a short stay of 2 nights in this hotel and my wife and I were impressed. Large,clean room,substantial breakfast and a short walk to the underground and the quick connections to Alexanderplatz. Thoroughly recommended ,especially for slightly older guests,like us. If coming from Schonefeld Airport, take the cheap regional express train-don't get on the S-Bahn,takes much longer and was suffering from disruptions because of trackwork

Reviews.Title: “a "gem"of an hotel”
Reviews.Author: morgangeth
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in this excellant hotel,and thers no wonder thers good reviews about this hotel,its very clean,breakfast very good,and its in a good district with plenty of bars+resturants,also we found it safe to walk the streets at night time,and we where very late!!.I would have no hesitation in staying inthe agon frankfurter again when we return to this great city.

Reviews.Title: “decent for the money”
Reviews.Author: daskamel
Reviews.Content: A perfectly decent hotel & good for saving a bit of money (we stayed 5 nights). Everything is orderly, clean, respectable. It was quiet despite being pretty full (German tourists & students). Breakfast is good & ample (one hot egg or meat dish if you can't get into the ubiquitous cold meats & cheeses!) A computer in the lobby area is handy. It's not hard to find thanks to perfect directions from another reviewer & didn't take too long to get to, but we found we got a bit tired of seeing Alexander Platz & its train station. Remarkably, we found quite good German dinners in the Passage just up the street (felt like eating in a mall)--the hotel staff will recommend it. Big portions (like almost everywhere) & veges!

Reviews.Title: “My opinion of Hotel Agon Frankfurter Allee”
Reviews.Author: Daleigha
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in this hotel, and were disappointed by the room. It was very small, and the beds were positioned foot - to -foot, which would ok if it was two friends, but I was with my boyfriend!! Also, the walls & ceiling were like paper, and we were woken on a few occasions by other guests coming in late in the evening. Having said that, the room was very clean, and the bathroom was lovely. The breakfast was very good - there was a good selection of rolls, meats, cheeses, cereal, fruit, yoghurt & coffee. The hotel was very handy to the U-bahn station, from which we were able to make our way all over berlin, quickly & easily. There were plenty of restaurants nearby, especially on boxhagner street, which is two minutes walk away. The area looks a bit dodgy, but it is totally fine for walking around - and is quiet most of the time - we never saw anyone that we were a bit wary of walking past. I felt the pictures of the hotel on the website were a bit misleading - the room we stayed in certainly didnt look like that!! And the bar etc is not as big as it would seem in the pictures either. There was a shopping centre nearby, on Frankfurter Allee, which had a good range of shops, and is also beside another U-bahn station. Like another reviewer, we also found the hotel very hard to find from the online instructions - we were wandering around for a good while before we finally found it!!

Reviews.Title: “Good city base”
Reviews.Author: RB-2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in July and found the hotel to be convenient and very clean. As a mother and daughter the twin beds suited us perfectly. Breakfast was a varied buffet. Ten minutes into the city by train. We felt safe in the area - don't be put off by the graffiti - this is a quiet residential area. We ate every night at the Leander restaurant around the corner. Very pleasant - varied menu. Would recommmend this hotel as a good base for the city and a nice place to return to after a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Value 4 Money!!”
Reviews.Author: veedubb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in December 2006 and give this place a big thumbs up!! We were lucky enough to be upgraded to an apartment which was a very pleasant surprise. breakfast was great staff were great location was great - easy enough to get to and from the airport using public transport. plenty of shops and restaurants nearby it's not a five star hotel but its very clean and in a safe area. 5 jaffas!! ps. berlin is a fantastic city!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, Great value”
Reviews.Author: FQTV1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in East Berlin, in the Friedrishain area. Although some have emphasized the heavy graffiti use and some other aspects of the hotel neighborhood it is just part of a normal look of this area. The neighborhood is completely safe and pleasant with no real threats 24/7 even for families. The hotel is one block south of Frankfurter Allee which is the main street crossing the area west to east. The nearest public transport station (one block away) is the U-Bahn Samariterstrasse which runs the U5 line to Alexanderplatz (less than 10 minute ride). A far away S-Bahn station “Frankfurter Allee” is considered to be more central but is a 10 to 15 minute walk and is not worth the effort as for most of your travel within the city you will use the nearby station and it will suffice. Getting to the hotel from the station is simple: Exit the U-Bahn and take the south side of Frankfurter Allee. On Colberstrasse or Kinzigstasse take a right (south) and then a left on Scharnweberstrasse. The hotel main gate entrance is on the street (21-23) and you need to enter the parking yard for the building entrance. The hotel has regular small rooms and “apartments” which are large ~70 square meter rooms equipped with a shower room + toilet, another toilet room and a small kitchen. The apartments are intended for 6 people (we were a family of 5). We paid 90 Euros per day including breakfast for all of us (booked directly with the hotel). We found the apartment clean and in a very good condition. The only “small” issue was the fact that the apartments face the parking area which can become noisy early morning and the fact that the ground floor windows face directly this area although for us this was really a minor issue when compared with the great convenience of this facility and its cost. The breakfast was excellent. It had all the basic stuff starting with scrambled eggs or soft/hard-boiled ones, variety of breads, sausages, chesses, tomatos, cucumbers, jam, cereals, puddings, coffee, tea, juices, milk, cakes (I think I covered all) – I really don’t understand some other reviewers which felt a bit disappointed (???). As pointed out by others there are many dining opportunities nearby. For the fast food lovers (if you are with kids or just in a hurry), Burger King and Subway and numerous Pizza houses are within your grasp (our favorite one was near the Samaritestrasse U-Bahn station which served oval shaped and very tasty pizzas…). You can ask the reception for more recommendations, most of them are a 10 minute walk south-west from the hotel and some are near the plaza (Mercure hotel) 2 blocks north-east from the hotel of Frankfurter Allee. The staff was helpful and assisted us with all the basic stuff we required (they all speak English). My family which are experienced travelers and used to various hotels, motels and zimmers of different variety and class found this hotel an excellent choice. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: maokkone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights. The room and other areas were _really_ clean. Beds were good and the staff was nice. Facilities included all you will need, but nothing beyond that, e.g. there were no decent bar in the hotel. Although, there are plenty of them near hotel. The breakfast was something you would expect from a decent hotel. U-bahn station was just a block away, so it's easy to getting around. Friedrichhain is a nice neighbourhood if you don't mind some ugly buildings occupied by squatters and graffities all over the places. As said there are lot of bars, restaurants and small shops just few blocks from the hotel. It was really value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal!”
Reviews.Author: KamaLinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in June. It was hard to find from the directions online, but when we finally did get there, it was very close to the metro station. It wasn't in a great neighborhood (there was an abandoned park nearby with some homeless people living in it), lots of graffiti, etc. The hotel was very clean. There was no flat sheet on the bed (which we found was common), but it looked like they wash the cover often. The double bed was 2 twins pushed together (also common). The TV had 2 English channels, MTV and CNN. There was free internet in the lobby, which we thought was great! The staff was helpful and spoke english well. There was an elevator. Breakfast was really good. There was an assortment of breads, meat, cheese, cereal, yogurt, juice, fruit, hot drinks and was buffet style. The bedroom was larger than expected. The windows opened out to the street below, but we closed them at night and had no problem with noise. The bathroom was really clean and nice. It was modernly decorated and looked really nice. Overall, we thought the hotel was really good and well worth the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Friendly and Good Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronniesut
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Argon Frankfurter Allee through an online agent. It represented good value for money and we were not disappointed. It is a small hotel, just 70 rooms, which caters for bed and breakfast. We were given a non-smoking room as requested and found it very clean with a nice sized bathroom. The bathroom had a walk in shower with shower gel dispenser, sink and toilet. The floor was tiled and everything in good condition. The towels were of a good size and changed every day. The beds were comfortable and the linen nice and white. There was a TV which had BBC World News and CNN. The carpet was clean and did not look worn. The breakfast was taken in the downstairs bar area. Again this was kept clean and tidy. The breakfast consisted of the usual tea/coffee/chocolate/orange juice, cereals, cold meats, cheeses, various breads, cake and also scrambled and boiled egg. We found it more than adequate to start our day on. The lady on duty in reception in the afternoon spoke fairly good English and was very helpful with directions on the public transport and restaurants. We travelled to the hotel from the airport by train to Alexanderplatz and then the U-Bhan to Samaritserstrs which was very inexpensive. The Hotel is ideally placed to use the public transport as the U-bhan is just around the corner. The ticket machines display English instructions too, just make sure you validate the ticket in the machine next to the ticket machine. Inspectors are frequent on the trains and fines for not having a ticket are instant. In 4 days we were asked for our tickets 3 times. The hotel is in what used to be the old eastern sector so don't be put off by the grey concrete buildings or the graffiti. In fact all the Berlin trains seems to be covered in graffiti on the outside as well as the buildings in the suburbs. Some of the train graffiti was very artistic. A lot of the buildings around the hotel are being refurbed on the outside. All in all I would not hesitate to recommend the Hotel Argon Frankfurter Allee for a short break in Berlin. It represents excellent value for money and is situated in an ideal location to access all the public transport. We had a very good break in Berlin and could not fault this hotel especially for the price we had paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dgjohnson
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel and great value for money. The hotel is situated in walking distance from the excellent efficient Underground system (Uberground), and we had no problem in getting around Berlin at all. The hotel was clean, had friendly staff and also had very good rooms. Breakfast was fine and the hotel is located in walking distance of many bars. However, the only downside is that it is in a very run down area where graffitti rules. The hotel itself is all clean on the outside, but the remaining buildings are very vandalised with paint cans. However this is East Berlin and it seems to be normal, but you would be paying a lot more to stay in West Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter59
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very easy to find once you master the underground system. We took Ryanair to Berlin and caught the train Frankfurter allee. It is in the East Part of Berlin although cheaper than it western counterparts this hotel was clean and the breakfast plentiful hot and cold eat as much as you want. I did have to ask for an extra pillow but there was no problem. Close to a small shopping and eating area and the Central of Berlin is accessible. Go at Christmas time the lights in Berlin are fantastic and it's great for history. We went on a free walkabout from the Berlin gates for 3 hours. Even their train stations are done up in fairy lights! Families go out in the evening and enjoy xmas fairs and rides and plenty of mull wine! I went up the televsion sky tower in Berlin which has a resturant revolving and it was great. Their transport system runs via numbers so once you get use to it it's easy. Would def go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alg555
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Agon for 3 nights in March 2007. The hotel was very clean with friendly staff and a good breakfast. The surrounding area does have a lot of graffiti but we felt very safe and as the U5 Samariterstrasse train station is only 200m away, the hotel becomes very convenient to get around Berlin. I would recommend obtaining the Berlin Welcome Card (areas ABC), which gives unlimited use of the trains, buses, trams and discounts to most tourist sites including Potsdam. Use the 100 or 200 bus which takes you around most of the tourist sites in Mitte. We followed a previous recommendation on Trip Advisor and ate at the La Palma Italian restaurant which is approx 200m away from the hotel (turn left then left again across the traffic lights then up on the left), the food was excellent. I would highly recommend Berlin and this hotel for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Agon Frankfurter Allee”
Reviews.Author: dvdagp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really woth it. We booked a double room and a three-bed room. The only problem we found was the small pillows. Everything else was simply perfect! Guests also have free internet access in reception. Staff friendly and continental breakfast really good. Hotel 200-300m away from the underground. We arrived to Schoenefeld Airport and went to the hotel with no problems thanks to the fantastic public transport. We recommend the "Kleingruppekarte" (ticket for small groups), which costs €15/day and allows a group of up to 5 people to use all kind of public transport. It is worth it when there are 3 of you or more. If not, just get the "Tageskarte" (ticket for a day), which costs €6/day/person. Eating out: there are some excellent places very near the hotel. We would recommend: 1) Restaurant Toscana, in Frankfurter Allee (fantastic atmosphere and food); 2) Restaurant La Palma (on Voigtstrasse, just off Frankfurter Allee); 3) Leander, just around the corner (come out of the hotel, turn left and then immediately to the right. Its about 50 yard on the left). Excellent beer and traditional German food but don’t expect an English menu.

Reviews.Title: “great service and vfm”
Reviews.Author: scallywag-7
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel for three nights and found the hotel to be great value for money. rooms very clean,great ensuite.hotel is a five minute walk to tube station and train takes ten minutes or so to get to some great bars.day ticket on train great value.will certainly visit again because there is so much to see and do and will stay at the agon again many thanks

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jmcateer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my first trip to Berlin with my wife and 3 year old son Ben. Hard to find any faults. Arrived late at night so it was not until next morning that I realised just how clean and spotless rooms were. NHS cleaners should be sent here for lessons. Breakfast was magnificant for continental buffet. Staff were extremly pleasant and very child friendly. Location excellent. Only fault I could find was the pillows were a bit thin for my liking but after a day walking around Berlin I had no trouble sleeping. Excellent value

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: villasis
Reviews.Content: from brussels me and my friends stayed in this hotel for 3 nights,again its better than the 2 hotels we stayed(amsterdam&brussels)location is accessible by underground 2 minutes walk ,breakfast was excellent,quite environment,clean environment,internet free,aproachable/helpful reception staff,again we had 3 single beds in 1 room,bathroom was spacious,enough water from shower,3 heater good for 1 room well lighted room,really enjoyed our stay in this hotel,absolutely deserved to be recommended to other tourist,no bad experience at all

Reviews.Title: “Agon Frankfurter All was a great deal”
Reviews.Author: joshbash
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very clean and nice. Also, stayed with my 14 year old and he enjoyed. It's definitely not luxurious. It's about 5 U-Baahn stps from alexanderplatz, but you pretty much need mass transport to go anywhere in Berlin and the trains are clean, comfortable, are on time and run often. Breakfast was very good. You can't beat the price for what you get, although I think Berlin room rates are lower than most of Europe. Nearby is the East Side Gallery Graffiti wall.
