The Turkish neighborhood in Kreuzberg across the river is quite interesting. Of course, near the old Berlin wall, there's lots to do and that's only about 15 minutes away by U-Bahn. Berlin is a wonderful, interesting city, perhaps the most in Europe of the 20th Century. It's growing now very nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: PollyMazzie
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a visit to Berlin. The city of Berlin is a lovely place to see and I would go back again someday but not to Hotel Agon Frankfurter Allee. I went with my husband and arrived in Schofeld Airport on Saturday 11th Novenber 2006. We decided to get the Train as we felt this would be the closest stop to our destination. The thing to be aware of is that the hotel is in the east of germany and so things there are basic. You will know the difference straight away when you travel to the west. The train station is about five minutes walk from the airport and you just have to follow the crowd, very easy to find it is sign posted in the airport. The train tickets are cheap. You can buy a day trip ticket for about 5 to 6 euro per person and it is well worth it. if you want to stay around the city a and b are ok but if you want to travel further then buy a ticket for districts a, b and c. The hotel is basic. I was very disappointed with the false advertising. The hot breakfast is hard bolied eggs and sausages one day and hard boiled eggs and scrambled eggs another day. They do supply a cold buffet and you will manage on that but it's not too exciting. There is no food available in the hotel other than breakfast. The reception desk is a section of the bar. It is really small and there is very little room for a number of guests to sit and enjoy a drink. No tea and coffee facilities in the bedrooms at all. There were two single beds pushed together to make a double and the mattresses are made of foam. If you have a back problem like me you will be in pain I can assure you of that. The temperature in the bedroom is always kept very warm so you will not be complaining of the cold in the room. Most of the staff are friendly and they will order a taxi if you need it. Another thing to be very aware of is that the hotel is stated to be in quiet residential area. The area is rough and you will be very aware of that when you get there. The picture of the hotel on the web site looks lovely. The bedroom on the web site is far from what you will be staying in when you get there. It just does not compair with reality. You have to go off the street through an arch way to find the front door of the hotel. On the street it is filthy everywhere. I would advise you to eat before you go back to the hotel at night instead of going back out to look for a restaurant. In the city you will find many nice places to eat. But closer to the hotel they are not so plentyful. I feel the hotel is certainly not a three staras advertised. I would suggest staying in west side instead. If you do the city trip for 20 euros per person you will see Checkpoint Charlie where you can get your passport stamped for 2 euros. You can also have your photo taken with USA soldiers at checkpoint Charlie for 1euro. Go to Subway opposite Checkpoint Charlie to eat. You can get Pizza or Pasta dishes all fro only 3euros. For those of you who like shopping. Go to the Galeria at Alexanderplaz, it is a huge and wonderful department store, just amazing I promise you. You will see it when you come out of the train station. C and A is also there too. I hope what I have written helps. After all this Berlin is a city we will certainly visit soon again. Pauline

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring \berlin”
Reviews.Author: bazzer99
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Agon Frankfurter Allee. Good clean comfortable Hotel with friendly english speaking staff. We got there early, 11am, expecting to just drop our case in the luggage room but, to our surprise, they had a room available straight away. Good location for exploring Berlin - Samariterstrasse tube station literally less the 200 yards away. Taxi from Tegel airport approx 30-35 mins - 20 - 25€. Plenty of reasonably priced good quality eateries nearby. Definitely worthwhile and great value. They even have a free internet terminal in reception!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel & Lively area”
Reviews.Author: upgrade1st
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday from 4 days in Berlin, having read all the other reviews on the city and the Hotel Agon before our trip. Public transport in Berlin is superb, easy once you know how and extremely clean, we flew into Berlin Schonefelde from Glasgow, further out of town than the other 2, Tegel & Templehof, but well served by train or bus. We went by train to Alexanderplatz then on the U-Bahn (subway ) to the stop Samaritserstrasse which is just around the corner from Hotel Agon. Our room was large and airy with en suite shower/loo, the reception staff spoke English and were very helpful in giving directions. Ask them for a map of the local area ( Friedrichshain) so you can check out your surroundings. The street lighting is very very DIM! However the area is quite safe. You are in the old East Berlin, tree-lined streets, lots of nice restaurants and bars, and just across Frankfurter Allee is the Plaza Passage....not quite a Mall but several nice restaurants (Italian Toscana is very good) and some pretty shops. I had read a recommendation of Bar Sando which is in Proskauer Strasse...nice cocktails and excellent food too! I would say there is an awful lot to see in and around Berlin...the City Bus Tour is good value for money and we also went to Potsdam ( on the train) which is a lovely town with Schloss Sans Souci as the highlight. Buy/borrow a guide book before your trip and if its a short visit like ours do your homework before you go! Finally as they say when raising a glass...Prosit!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an area with good amenities”
Reviews.Author: MrWig
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights for a wedding anniversary trip after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. Hotel appears new, modern and clean. Our room was fine (no. 400 twin beds pushed together, even though listed as a double) - if a little plain, with comfy beds, hot powerful showers. Free internet access in reception is useful for researching sights, checking e mail etc. We arrived after 10pm and asked reception about the best place to head for something to eat. We were given a map of the local area and directed toward Simon Dach str (just head out of the hotel, cross the road and turn left along Kinzigstr. When you come to the busy crossroads go diagonally onto Grunberger Str and you will come to it - about 10 - 15 minutes walk). There are loads of good value restaurants, cafe bars, and corner shops for your bottle of wine to take back to the room! You've got to try a kebab - not greasy like in the UK, lovely salad and sauce. Breakfast is usual continental standard - cereals, rolls, continental cheeses and meats and is served until10am which means we had a nice lie in each morning. All reception staff we encountered were really helpful, English speaking and pleasant. There is a left luggage room which is a bonus if you have a later flight back. Overall I would recommend you stay in this hotel for its location to local amenities (underground station 3 mins walk, and aforementioned places to eat/drink ) and for its great value rooms and service, but its not for you if you like a picturesque stroll of a night as the street lights are dim and there is a lot of graffiti (althougth not as much as Rome). A final note on transfer from Shoenfeld Airport - if you do use the trains and U Bahn (underground) when you get off U line 5, exit in the direction of Kinzigstr. and Colbestr and then turn into Kinzigsrt. at the junction with Schamweberstr. turn left and you will be 10 mtrs from the hotel entrance. We used "German Transfers" for a return taxi to the airport (approx 40 mins each way) cost 46 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Globetrot30
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on trip advisor i was looking forward to staying at this hotel. On arrival the hotel was easy to find, just 3 mins walk to the tube station. Very efficient staff at reception, gave us the key to our room. The room was very small but very clean. It stated all room had mini bars but we did not, we had room 106 and appeared fine, however we were over the courtyard (the back of the hotel) early hours of the morning we were woken every night by screaming drunk students who rolled in after a night out. This hotel is a non smoking hotel and eveyone wishing to smoke uses the courtyard right outside our bedroom window. The hotel was full of students and school trips, one night we had to unpolug the phone as we were getting hoax calls all through the night. The room is also next to the stair well so that was constanly banging on our wall. My friend and I are both in our mid twenties and like a drink but the students were very annoying and put me off of writing a good review. Maybe it wasw partly our fault as we could have asked to change rooms however we were only there for 3 nights. Good location and very good breakfast buffet, but wouldnt reccommend unless you are a deep sleeper. REccommend a trip to the concerntration cam to sashenhausen!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: carrickbeg
Reviews.Content: Mu husband and I stayed for four nights at the Agon Frankfurter Allee at the end of August 2006. We found it very easily after following the advice of other reviewers. We flew into Schonefeld and bought single train tickets for only €2.10 each that covered the trip to Alexanderplatz, then on to Samaritarstrasse. There was a very helpful City Volunteer at the ticket machine in Schonefeld who showed us how to use the machine. When you come out of Samaritarstrasse subway onto Frankfurter Allee, it would be helpful to have a street map, as, like us, you may find yourselves on the wrong side of the street for the hotel. The hotel is a short walk from the subway and we felt quite safe in the area, even very late at night. However, it might be advisable at night to avoid the street with the patch of wasteland and use the street further along. Some drunks hang out in the wasteland and though they didn't hassle us in any way, best to avoid them. The exterior of the hotel is nice and traditional looking, while the interior is modern, and spotlessly clean. The only downside was that the room was very small, although the bathroom was large. Breakfast was really good, and served in a nice red brick basement area. We were really glad we chose to stay in East Berlin, as the atmosphere was relaxed and eating out was very cheap. We found a restaurant called La Palma on Voigtstrasse Street, just off Frankfurter Allee, and they had the best food we've ever tasted. They serve everything from pasta to pizza to steak, and you can get a great meal with wine and beer for around €21 for two. After dinner, head to the Brazilian bar called Sando on Proskauer Strasse, where they do the best cocktails ever, really huge, for only €4. Theres a small bar in the hotel, but we didn't use it and we saw no-one else using it either. It's next to the breakfast room, and it would be great if they left this open for guests to use in the evenings, perhaps with a large-screen tv for showing videos. That way guests could socialise a bit. I find the lack of communal areas like this a big drawback in small contintental hotels. The location of the hotel is quite good as it's easy to get into the city centre, and quite quick on the subway. However, we were always glad to get back to our laidback little patch of East Berlin after all the walking and sightseeing. Our room was at the back of the hotel and was very quiet. We slept soundly, thanks to a combination of all the walking, the fabulous food at La Palma and the delicious cocktails at Sando. It was in no way thanks to the strange pillows. They're sort of flat, like miniature duvets. We had to ask for two more each, so it wasn't too bad. Another thing to be aware of is, check in is at two pm. Inconvenient if you arrive early in the morning, although you can leave your bags. Would I stay at this hotel again? Yes, if I got as good a deal again, only €216 for two of us, for four nights B&B. All in all, a memorable trip - helpful and friendly people everywhere, a wonderful city with wonderful food. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: FreeTravel81
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and helpful (no problem with English speaking there). There's free Internet (one station only) near the reception - very helpful (tip: the PC is usually free at night). The location is good - about 200 meters to a U-bahn station to Alexander Platz (5-10 minute ride). Although the hotel isn't in the beating heart of the city - it felt "close enough" and it didn't bother me. At night - the street might be a bit too dark - but I didn't feel threatened. There are several groceries, Burger King, etc' near the hotel. Breakfast is just fine - fruit, juice, milk, cornflakes, 3 different types of bread, cheese, etc' The room (mine had a single bed) is excellent - clean, TV, bathroom, all good and shiny. This hotel is indeed great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Arctophile28
Reviews.Content: I took my great-nephew as a treat to celebrate his 18th (I am slightly older at 50!). We both had a great time and found this hotel to be clean, comfortable and friendly. Excellent choices at breakfast and good service. We stayed for 4 nights and the secret we wished we'd found sooner is that there are lots of great restaurants and bars very nearby - although the only noise we heard whilst at the hotel were some English stag party celebrators who were "singing" in the courtyard. Take the advice of the hotel reception staff on where to go - the nearby restaurants and bars rival any in European holiday resorts. One word of warning - expect graffitti (though none at the hotel). Its everywhere in the east and some in the west and initially is quite shocking but if you are interested there is a history to it. We walked around at night and always felt completely safe. Go and enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great city, Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: big-murdo
Reviews.Content: A wonderful four days was capped nicely by staying at this lovely hotel based in the east of Berlin, which was only a few minutes walk from the U-Bahn which took you to Alexanderplatz in the city centre. A very clean and well run hotel with pleasant staff, providing a superb traditional European breakfast between 7 and 10 in the morning. For the price that we paid, this must come close to the best hotel that we have stayed at. No problems at all. Berlin goes down as the most interesting city that I have visited with obviously a lot of history on show, however it is extremely modern with most of the buildings straight out of the wrapper. For a piece of historical interest, go to Sachsenhausen concentration camp which is north of Berlin in a town called Orangieburg, about 25 minutes on the S-Bahn. Berlin and the hotel both get 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Want to keep this one a secret”
Reviews.Author: amelda marcus
Reviews.Content: For value for money this is without doubt one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. My husband asked me not to write a review but to keep this one a secret. My whole experience of Berlin was fantastic. First class hotel, first class people and first class city. I hope it does not get ruined like a lot of the other cities with the stag and hen parties. The hotel is all the other reviews said and the area is fine. I never felt threathened or unsafe anywhere. In fact after Barcelona and Rome where everyone warned us about the thieves and we were always worried about something happening, Berlin was very relaxed and safe. Make sure you have your ticket for the underground. The inspectors wear plain clothes and were on the trains all the time. There is an instant 40 euro fine. A 72 hour pass costs 19 euro 90 cent and that gives you unlimited travel on trains, buses, trams and underground and these can be purchased in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very positive experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at this hotel. After reading the other reviews, I had some concerns about the area, but found the area to be perfectly fine. For the money, the hotel was a great value. Our room was large and clean, and breakfast was very good. The staff was helpful in directing us. Unless you are a traveler who needs to have all the main sights right outside your door, the location is great. It's just a few minute walk to the U-Bahn stop and easy access to all the major sights. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great price”
Reviews.Author: mot29
Reviews.Content: The Agon Frankfurter-Allee is an all around great deal. Comfortable, but small rooms, clean, excellent continental breakfast, very friendly staff, easily accessed by the u-bahn, lots of reasonably priced restaurants within a short walk. The neighborhood looks a bit dicey with all the graffiti, but that seems to be what much of the former east looks like. I'd definitely stay again, and the prices -- 2 nights @75 Euros and 2 nights @45 Euros were great. Plus, book online and you get a 5% discount. My room was on the 4th floor on the courtyard side of the building and most evenings late I was able to snag a wi-fi signal from the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wood-burners
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights in Berlin staying at the Frankfurter Allee mainly as a result of the excellent (mainly) feedback on Tripadvisor and the price compared to other hotels. Without repeating too much what the majority of visitors to this hotel seem to think, our impressions having stayed in many cities and small towns in Germany over the last few years, of this hotel can only be described as very favourable. Could not fault the hotel,room,staff,breakfast,price and overall stay...full marks. Would we stay there again?....Probably not.....the area is by no means the best. I have never seen so much graffitti anywhere (even Venice). There are drunks and winos all over the place and although we had no direct contact with them...it was not the environment I would want to holiday in with my wife and 12 year old child and sometimes you dont always want to travel again for your evening meal after being out all day. The whole area around the hotel ( we walked round quite a bit) was pretty grim and you really need to travel in to the city to eat in a nice environment. Having said all this....the overall atmosphere around Berlin and traveling on the u-bahn at night was a lot less threatening than you would find in an equivalent size English city.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: chickencurry007
Reviews.Content: I agree with the traveller from Durham, NC. This hotel is great. I did have a slight problem finding it, but the Durham, NC directions are spot-on. This hotel is modern, clean and the breakfast buffet was one of the best I've had travelling. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bedroom or broom cupboard?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read the reports on this website we were expecting the twin bed situation in place of the usual double bed. What we didn't expect was a tiny room with the beds laid end to end! The placement of the rest of the furniture in the room (all screwed into the wall and floor) meant we could not rearrange the room and only just managed to get the beds in side by side (but without access to the wardrobe). We complained at Reception and were greeted with a decidely frosty response and informed that "their was nothing they could do" and the reason our room was so small was because we had "booked through Expedia and not directly with the hotel". As this was a part of a birthday trip for my partner, you can imagine how angry we were at being treated as second class citizens! At least the buffet was nice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at Agon Frankfurter Allee. I was very pleased and would recommend the hotel to most travellers. For the price the accommodations were excellent. Everything was new and spotlessly clean. The room was basic but had more furnishings than most European budget hotels. The bathroom was extremely nice and typical of a more expensive room. All rooms have only showers; the sink had surrounding surface area and shelves above. (Bring facial tissues and bar soap if you require them, as only liquid soap is provided.) Don't be put off by the location. It is perfectly safe and convienient to all parts of the city, given the superb public transportation system. On finding the hotel (as previous instructions can be misinterpreted): as you take U-Bahn from Alexanderplatz, exit train to right, at end of platform take exit to right, at top you will be 30-40 feet from corner of Frankfurter Allee and Kinzigstrasse, turn right on Kinzigstrasse, at end of block turn left, hotel is 1/2 way down on left side of this street. Only a 5 minute walk. Staff friendly, breakfast buffet has a wide selection. All in all, a wise choice. I've been to Berlin several times and have paid three times as much for a fancier, but not necessarily better, room.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having never visited Berlin, and with the city being so huge, I was clueless to the best location to stay. My comments would be, that you are not by any of the main tourist sites nor are you too far away either. You are just 5 U Bahn (subway) stops away from Alexander Platz. The area around the hotel has been described as rough. Well I would not be concerned going out at any hour of the day with any of my belongings and feel intimidated. The area is much like any other area. I don't think I saw one threatening or worrying looking person in my whole time in Berlin. Unlike most of Britains major towns or cities the people of Berlin seem to respect personal belongings. Many times I saw people leave their bags unattended, and their shopping on their bicycles, their bicycles unlocked, video screens on the subway unvandalised. It seems that respect of property and law and order prevails strongly still in this part of the world. The people are friendly and seem genuine and warm. There is grafitti around the hotel as there is everywhere, even in the poshest of districts there seems no room left anywhere to leave a tag. The trees, the pavement, the roads are heavily marked with spray paint. More on the location of the hotel; If you come out of the front of the hotel (only way) you turn right, then next right about 10 metres, then walk to the bottom of the street to the main road, about 100 metres then you are at the subway, (Samaritersr) approximately 2 minutes walk. From here you can travel all over Berlin and beyond for €6 per day. One of my great concerns was fathoming out how to use the subway, trains, buses etc. It could not be simpler. As you go into the subway station, walk down to the platform, there you will see a machine that dispenses your tickets. On getting to the machine, you touch the screen to select your language, select what type of ticket you want, ie single journey (about €2.10, day pass, about €5.80, or 2 day, I think? You can also choose which zones you want, A & B or AB & C. I went for AB & C as this means you can travel on the subway (U Bahn) the buses, the trams and the S Bahn (trains, but some also do go underground). One of these tickets costs just €6 per day for unlimited travel, and you can go as far north as Sachsenhausen, the Olympic Stadium etc. You can feed in notes and just about any coins. You then need to put your ticket in the little bollard shaped object next to the ticket machine to validate it. Once you've done this your ticket is valid until 3am the next morning. If you buy a ticket you can keep it for as long as you like without it going out of date, but once you've validated it (punched it in one of the bollard thingies) it will then run out at 3am next morning. If you are thinking of holding onto your ticket and hope that you can get away with the same ticket, beware! We went a full 2 days, and probably a hundred or more tube stops and no one challenged us. We went in and out of subways unchallenged. The next couple of days we were asked to show our ticket about 5 times. The checkers are usually dressed in jeans and a t-shirt and you wouldn't have a clue. If you have a ticket out of date, a ticket not validated or no ticket, you will get an on the spot €40 fine. Back to the hotel: The staff were absolutely brilliant! I reckon I saw about 4 or 5 different women receptionists and one man. Three of the lady receptionists were an absolute scream. At one point when I was using the free internet pc by the reception desk I was struggling to find the @ key, 2 of them came from behind the desk and were fighting over me to show me! (Must be my striking resemblance to Brad Pitt!) Indeed I can not praise the staff enough, they were very helpful and I had a great laugh with them. (Who said the Germans don't have a sense of humour?) My room was huge!!! I got apartment 1 which is back out of the reception into a white building opposite. As I walked in I was astounded at the size of the room. There was only myself and the wife staying, but the living room had 4 double windows, a table and chairs, a 3 piece suite, 2 single beds pushed together, a triple wardrobe, a tv with about 20 odd channels, (only about 2 English, BBC World and CNN), a writing desk and chairs, a mini bar. The hallway led onto a bathroom with sink, toilet and shower, then down the corridor to another bathroom with toilet and sink, then onto the kitchen with a sink and cupboards and a little cooker. Great room, but massive. Breakfast in the morning was served to the left of reception which is in the cellar of the main building. You can tell that the building is a converted warehouse, but well done and pleasantly renovated without being flashy. The food was not bad, typically, a couple of cereal options, boiled or scrambled eggs, fresh fruit salad with lychees, pineapple, mango, guava, various dry German breads, cheese cold meats, selection of very nice yoghurts, cakes, jams and a few other things. you get a pot of coffee on your table. The clientele of the hotel seem to be mainly German with a few Brits, Americans, Canadians, French, Dutch and Italians making up the rest. It is for this reson that you will have half a dozen people staring at you for the entirety of the time you eat your breakfast. I don't know why Germans do this, but you just have to ignore it. Out and about round the hotel: I could not believe it when I got the bill for the food in the various bars and cafes in the vicinity. I thought I would try one of the highly recommended authentic Turkish kebabs, they come in a 12" pizza base style bread with sesame seeds and comprise of sliced chicken, all the salad and choice of dressings. This is a decent sized meal. I had one of these, my wife had the veggie equivalent, I had a pint of best beer, and a bottle of diet coke for my wife. The bill was less than €6 (I've paid more than that for a pint of beer in Budapest, Prague and Moscow) in a capital city of one of the worlds leading economies. This was commonplace around not just this area, but the whole of Berlin, the food seems so cheap. There is a cafe opposite the hotel which I went to and bought a couple of turkey salad baguettes, a couple of egg mayo barm cakes a donut and a bottle of sprite and that was only €6. And the food seems to be good wherever you go. Anything else about the location of the hotel? I witnessed a group of about 3 or 4 drunks that hang out near the corner shop to the left of the hotel as you look at it, they look away as if embarassed to offend and quickly move. I was delighted I stayed at the Agon Frankfurter Allee and would highly recommend you stay there. I loved the people of Berlin, I thought every person bar none went out of their way as much as possible to help often a bit embarassed at their lack of knowledge of English, but tried their best. A few general points about Berlin: There is a fair bit of work going on, on the undergrounds. There are a few delays because of this, nothing to be worried about, usually about 10 minutes you have to get off the train and back on again, and usually in the evening. The subways get hot as they don't have air con, and a lot of them run over ground. The checkpoint Charlie Museum lets too many in at once and is packed out with kids screaming and acting about. It's expensive at €9.50 each, you pay lots of extras and you can't use your camera. You can go up the Reichstag dome for free for great views, but the queues can be long if you go mid morning to early afternoon. The city is truly massive, so plan where you want to go and be prepared to sit for hours of your visit on the subway/bus/tram.

Reviews.Title: “A surprise in East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: travellers067
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated five metro stops from Alexanderplatz at Samariterstrasse in East Berlin. The area is not smart but appears to be developing. The streets leading off Frankfurterallee are a little gloomy but not threatening. The hotel is situated about a block from the U-bahn and is smartly painted and newly renovated. Our room was in an annexe of four across a small courtyard from the main building and was very quiet. The reception staff, with the exception of one girl who was unfriendly and unsmiling, were pleasant and helpful. The room was a good size and well furnished with a bright modern bathroom with good quality fittings. Breakfast was generous and good quality and we appreciated the free Internet access min the foyer. We stayed at the hotel for five nights in late February 2006 and for E55 per night including breakfast we felt it was very good value and would stay here again. We discovered this hotel through Trip Advisor which we found to be a brilliant resource for booking 9 hotels on our 5-week trip through Europe. We weren't disappointed with any of our choices and we felt we got excellent value everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Celotajs
Reviews.Content: We have been travelling from Canada to Europe a lot lately (Dublin, London, Riga, Paris and Berlin in the last 8 months), and this is the best hotel we have stayed at so far for the price. While the neighbourhood is still fairly East Berlin circa 1990, the location one block from the U-bahn (subway) is really convenient to get anywhere in Berlin. Our room was big, contemporary and clean, with nice thick walls (we had quite thin ones in Paris). We never ran out of hot water for showers and the bathroom floor was heated. The continental breakfast buffet was great and available until 10:00, and included hot scrambled and boiled eggs in addition to the usual cereal, breads, meats and cheeses. If you had to rent a hair dryer before, now you can just borrow one for a 10 EUR deposit, which you get back when you return the dryer. I have one caveat about which Trip Advisor warned us before we went: double beds are two twins pushed together. While we made out OK with some slippage, if the beds had to be two twins together, it would have been nice to have a queen mattress cover and fitted sheet over both. We had this in Dublin and it worked great. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leeson41
Reviews.Content: I concurr with everything the traveller from Wells, Somerset has written. My husband and I and two friends stayed in this great hotel for 4 nights. The staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful and the hotel comfortable and clean. We had rooms on the 4th floor that were spacious and warm. The transport system in Berlin must be the best in the world, so efficient, clean and runs on time. So it is very easy to catch the U-Bahn at Samariterstrasse, just around the corner from hotel and onto the S-Bahn at Alexandraplatz. Incidentally if you get off the U-Bahn at Frankfurter Tor - you can walk down Karl Marx Allee and see all the wonderful building as you head back toward the hotel. There is a wonderful indoor shopping mall at Frankfurter Allee U-bahn station - don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: CharlieDogUk
Reviews.Content: Having read the various views on trip advisor and expedias website we where pretty confident that this Hotel was going to be better than average! and wasn't it just! excellent large clean room with decoration that cannot be more than a year old, bathroom spacious with a shower only (great for us!). Just to confirm it is two beds pushed together so not idea for honeymoon couples if you know what I mean!! Our major concern looking at the maps of Berlin was that the Hotel seemed to be a fair way out (1km from Alexanderplatz) fortunately the Germans have an excellent – (like really excellent) public transport system we used the Samariterstrasse U-Bahn Station 3-5mins walk around the corner from the hotel (use this station when you arrive as well), then on the U-Bahn only at the most 10mins from Alexander Platz, Potsdammer Platz etc.. also this hotel is on the right side of Berlin if you are planning on arriving at Schonefeld Airport. Various other reviews had mentioned that there was a lot of graphitti in the area if this is the case then they must have had their eyes shut walking around the rest of Berlin – Berlin is plastered with the stuff but most of it is none offensive and really quite creative so get used to it… saying that all the public places and transportation system is graphitti free which leads to a pleasant travelling environment. Breakfast was very German/Dutch cold ham, bread and cheese. Though they did also have cereal scrambled eggs and hard boiled eggs. Its not table service at breakfast so don’t sit there like a lemon waiting for someone to offer tea or coffee – it wont happen. Again excellent choice for a hotel at this price. Eating out: there some excellent little place very near the hotel we would recommend Leander just around the corner (come out of the hotel turn left then immediately right its about 50 yard on the left) excellent beer and traditional German food (don’t expect an English menu). All in All excellent would I stay again YES!

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend, both students, chose to stay at the Frankfurter allee after looking for a cheap deal. After easily using the U Bahns to get to Samariterstrasse station (take the U5 from Alexanderplatz) when you get off turn right then at the top of the steps turn right again, its the quickest exit!!!!!Then turn back on yourself, go past the video centre and turn left, there it is!We struggled to find it for 5 mins, so hope they help! The hotel itself is comfortable and clean. Our room was larger than expected, had 3 made beds (we booked a double room!) but one of which was a double bed. the beds were comfortable and the room had everything we needed and was nice and warm, good considering the outside temperature! A nice clean, huge bathroom was also a bonus. We booked and got a non smoking room, which we were glad of, after reading some of the previous comments. The staff were helpful but we didnt see them much. Breakfast was also good, a good selection of cold meats, bread, fruit and cereals. The area around the hotel is good, only 5 station stops from the centre, more local with shops slightly cheaper and yet there are still some cools bars (lounge 11) and cute little restauraunts alsongside local pubs if you fancy it. The main areas we explored were alexanderplatz, Haschescher Markt, Potzdamerplatz and Zoologischer Garten. All great! Definately recommend the insider tour walk of the city, half a day tour of the main tourist sights gets them all done quickly and in detail of youre not staying long, great guides, really informative and helpful, they meet outside AMPM at the Haschescher Markt Station around 10.30 everyday i think. Also meeting there is a 3 times a week pub crawl which we definately recommend! Met some great people and get out of the touristy bar scene a little, good experience, and alcohol included in the price, the guides also just as up for it as the tourists! If you are planning on going out, heres a tip - don't get dressed up much, Berlin is a laid back city and no-one was dressed up in more than jeans in all bars and clubs. Also highly recommended is a trip up the TV tower!Although costing 7.50, definatly worth it, sit in the revolving restauraunt for a drink! Amazing! Visit Zoologisher Garten for some shopping, especially KaDeWe (aka German selfridges)buy some cake on the 6th floor - HEAVEN!!! Also a great Italian restauraunt called Ferri's next to the Levi's shop i think - good value and tasty. At Potzdamer Platz visit the Sony Centre and the Austrailian restauraunt - again very tasty and good value. All in all food is relatively cheap in Germany, however drinks expensive. For those looking for familiarity, the Hard Rock Cafe at Zoologisher Garten is easy enough to find and has entertainment every wednesday with food slightly cheaper. Definately buy a travel ticket, the public transport is great, runs into the night (however not through the night, like we were told!) and turns up exactly on time and is very regular! Taxis are also much cheaper than your average. All in all Berlin is a great city, and the Frankfurter allee is a good choice, although off the beaten track, easy and quick to get to and even in a taxi from main attractions cost no more than 15 Euros. Would definately stay again, a great base for a city break, accessible, comfortable and in a cool little area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Basic”
Reviews.Author: Jane22
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed at Hotel Agon for three nights at the end of January. The hotel put me in mind of a travel lodge, or a Howard Johnson chain hotel. It definately served its purpose, somewhere to sleep and have a shower. The bedding and bathroom were both sparkling clean. The room was warm, and included bedside lockers, a desk with a TV, and a wardrobe. So, if you are literally having 40 winks, and then out for a day of sightseeing its fine. Breakfast was served from 7am till 10am. Lots to choose from including; breads, cheeses, cold meats, scrambled egg, boiled egg, cereal, chocolate cake, chocolate custard, yoghurt, fresh fruit, the list goes on!Truly a great selection and very filling. Now here are the more negative points... The hotel is in the East of the city, and the surrounding neighbourhood is pretty grim. Lots of grafitti, lots of dog dirt, you get the idea. There really wasn't much of an atmosphere if you wanted to go out in the evening. The hotel 'bar' consists of about 6 barside stools. The area beyond this is the breakfast area, which is not opened at night. So, if you think you will get to know other guests at the hotel, your wrong, as no one was ever at the bar the entire time we stayed! I think they have a couple of beers on tap and a few bottles of wine etc, its by no means fully stocked. Finally, and this is my biggest complaint, they do not appear to have double beds. We booked a double room aprox three months in advance and arrived to discover two singles pushed together. There wasn't even a double duvet, just two singles! This was ok for a nights sleep, but if you have a romantic break in mind i would definately pass! On inspection of the photographs on the website, we discovered a chair had been cleverly placed at an angle to cover the join of the two beds. I think this is a pretty sneaky technique, and in my opinion suggested that the hotel knew their bed arrangements were not quite up to scratch. The smoking versus non smoking rooms as a lot of people have discussed, does seem to be a problem. We booked requesting smoking. Rang to confirm closer to our departure and was told unfortunately only non smoking was available. Arrived, and low and behold an ashtray in the room! So it's really hit or miss! If you are a non smoker good luck!! All in all, it's a good budget hotel. Close to the U bahn, all major attractions can be reached easily. We bought the day ticket for about 5 euro each and so could zip back and forth across the city all day. The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful, and will give u a map, and hightlight directions on it to wherever you want to go in the local neighbourhood. Good value for money on the whole.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmkay
Reviews.Content: Read some great reviews on this site and found a reasonable deal on expedia so booked our 3 night stay between christmas and new year about 3 months in advance. Now this is my second trip to berlin and one of my great loves is the S-Bahn and the views you get travelling from A to B, unfortunately it's underground to get to this hotel but that's okay, they are quick (about 10 minutes or so to one of the more central stations) and only 3 minutes or so from the hotel, if you come out the correct exit (unlike us). Hotel itself was relatively easy to find, we had to ask directions on Samariter Str because it was night time, we had cases and we were in a blizzard! Check in was straightforward and the room was large, 2 windows that open properly over the main street below, en suite bathroom, we were on the top floor, unfortunately we qickly realised this was a non-smoking room, no ashtrays, no tell tale smell of smoke Uh-oh. Both me and my partner smoke so a quick call down to reception and it was confirmed, we had a non-smoking room and apparently couldn't be moved, we were told we could smoke at the bar. Yes you have to 'rent' a hairdryer, not the best hairdryer either, probably cost less than 10 euros to replace it. Breakfast was fine, we had it included in our hotel costs and there was more than enough choice, my only complaint would be the bread rolls, normally one of the best things about german hotels, these ones were pretty nasty and the fresh orange tasted like it was a powder mixed with water concoction. Good points, the hotel was new and clean, the staff were friendly, free internet in the bar, it was toasty warm indoors (you can control your own level of heat in the bedrooms with standard radiators), fully functioning windows (always a favourite of mine) and BBC world and CNN on the television. Handy to have a bar downstairs, especially for those of us given the wrong room! I would recommend it to a friend though and if I ever give up smoking I would probably go back!

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Styles Berlin City Ost
HotelInfo.Address: Scharnweberstrasse 21-22, 10247 Berlin, Germany
